intro: Pouteria adolfi-friederici subsp. keniensis, commonly known as the Kenyan star apple, is a tropical tree native to East Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers and edible, sweet, star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, while its bark is smooth and greyish in color. The fruit is often used in local cuisines and has economic value in some regions.
